segment.source: Start a Microsoft Intune trial and deploy iOS PIN policy
segment.target: Start a Microsoft Intune trial and deploy iOS PIN policy

segment.source: Start a Microsoft Intune trial and deploy iOS PIN policy
segment.target: Start a Microsoft Intune trial and deploy iOS PIN policy

segment.source: These step-by-step instructions help you set up an Intune trial and configure a PIN policy for iOS devices.
segment.target: These step-by-step instructions help you set up an Intune trial and configure a PIN policy for iOS devices.

segment.source: For a list of other common Intune evaluation tasks that you can try, see Common Microsoft Intune evaluation tasks.
segment.target: For a list of other common Intune evaluation tasks that you can try, see Common Microsoft Intune evaluation tasks.

segment.source: These instructions explain:
segment.target: These instructions explain:

segment.source: Review prerequisites for this task
segment.target: Review prerequisites for this task

segment.source: Create a free Intune trial account
segment.target: Create a free Intune trial account

segment.source: Create a test user
segment.target: Create a test user

segment.source: Configure an iOS pin policy for the test user
segment.target: Configure an iOS pin policy for the test user

segment.source: Validate that the policy is enforced on an iOS device
segment.target: Validate that the policy is enforced on an iOS device

segment.source: Review prerequisites for this task
segment.target: Review prerequisites for this task

segment.source: Windows PC with Internet Explorer - for doing administrative tasks
segment.target: Windows PC with Internet Explorer - for doing administrative tasks

segment.source: iOS 7.1 or later device for testing user policy validation
segment.target: iOS 7.1 or later device for testing user policy validation

segment.source: Phone to authenticate yourself during trial sign-up
segment.target: Phone to authenticate yourself during trial sign-up

segment.source: Create a free Intune trial account
segment.target: Create a free Intune trial account

segment.source: If you already have an Intune subscription, skip this section and go to the next section.
segment.target: If you already have an Intune subscription, skip this section and go to the next section.

segment.source: Using a Windows PC, right-click Internet Explorer (IE) and select InPrivate Browsing.
segment.target: Using a Windows PC, right-click Internet Explorer (IE) and select InPrivate Browsing.

segment.source: Go to the Intune sign-up portal, provide the requested information, and click Next.
segment.target: Go to the Intune sign-up portal, provide the requested information, and click Next.

segment.source: Enter a user ID and password for your admin account and click Next.
segment.target: Enter a user ID and password for your admin account and click Next.

segment.source: You'll use this ID to log in to the Intune portal to do your admin tasks.
segment.target: You'll use this ID to log in to the Intune portal to do your admin tasks.

segment.source: Enter your cell phone number and click Text me to validate your number.
segment.target: Enter your cell phone number and click Text me to validate your number.

segment.source: Save the information shown on the screen, and then click You're ready to go....
segment.target: Save the information shown on the screen, and then click You're ready to go....

segment.source: Create a test user
segment.target: Create a test user

segment.source: Using a Windows PC, click Start to go to the user management page.
segment.target: Using a Windows PC, click Start to go to the user management page.

segment.source: Click the + button to add a user.
segment.target: Click the + button to add a user.

segment.source: On the Create new user account page:
segment.target: On the Create new user account page:

segment.source: Provide the test user information.
segment.target: Provide the test user information.

segment.source: Select the Type password option.
segment.target: Select the Type password option.

segment.source: Clear the Make this person change their password the next time they sign in check box.
segment.target: Clear the Make this person change their password the next time they sign in check box.

segment.source: Click Create.
segment.target: Click Create.

segment.source: On the user creation confirmation page, click Close.
segment.target: On the user creation confirmation page, click Close.

segment.source: Click the Refresh button to see the test user you created.
segment.target: Click the Refresh button to see the test user you created.

segment.source: Configure an iOS pin policy for the test user
segment.target: Configure an iOS pin policy for the test user

segment.source: Using a Windows PC, set the MDM authority to be Intune:
segment.target: Using a Windows PC, set the MDM authority to be Intune:

segment.source: Go to Intune Management console, log in with your admin account, and click Start Managing Mobile Devices.
segment.target: Go to Intune Management console, log in with your admin account, and click Start Managing Mobile Devices.

segment.source: The Mobile Device Management authority page opens.
segment.target: The Mobile Device Management authority page opens.

segment.source: Click the Set Mobile Device Management Authority link.
segment.target: Click the Set Mobile Device Management Authority link.

segment.source: Enable iOS devices for enrollment.
segment.target: Enable iOS devices for enrollment.

segment.source: This process sets up a trusted certificate between the Apple Push Notification Service (APNs) and your Intune subscription.
segment.target: This process sets up a trusted certificate between the Apple Push Notification Service (APNs) and your Intune subscription.

segment.source: Click Enable the iOS and Mac OS X platform.
segment.target: Click Enable the iOS and Mac OS X platform.

segment.source: Click Download the APNs Certificate Request.
segment.target: Click Download the APNs Certificate Request.

segment.source: Specify a file name and location for your Certificate Signing Request (CSR), and then click Save.
segment.target: Specify a file name and location for your Certificate Signing Request (CSR), and then click Save.

segment.source: This file holds the public key that corresponds to a private key held by your Intune subscription.
segment.target: This file holds the public key that corresponds to a private key held by your Intune subscription.

segment.source: Click Apple Push Certificates portal to open a new tab.
segment.target: Click Apple Push Certificates portal to open a new tab.

segment.source: Enter your Apple ID and password, and click Sign in.
segment.target: Enter your Apple ID and password, and click Sign in.

segment.source: This ID can be the one you use on your iOS device to get apps from the iOS App Store.
segment.target: This ID can be the one you use on your iOS device to get apps from the iOS App Store.

segment.source: Click Create a Certificate.
segment.target: Click Create a Certificate.

segment.source: Read Apple’s Terms of Use, select the check box, and click Accept.
segment.target: Read Apple’s Terms of Use, select the check box, and click Accept.

segment.source: Click Browse.
segment.target: Click Browse.

segment.source: Select the CSR file that you saved earlier, and click Open.
segment.target: Select the CSR file that you saved earlier, and click Open.

segment.source: Click the Upload button.
segment.target: Click the Upload button.

segment.source: When you are prompted to download a JSON file, click Save as.
segment.target: When you are prompted to download a JSON file, click Save as.

segment.source: Specify a location for your JSON file and click Save.
segment.target: Specify a location for your JSON file and click Save.

segment.source: If your page doesn’t redirect automatically after a few seconds, click Cancel.
segment.target: If your page doesn’t redirect automatically after a few seconds, click Cancel.

segment.source: To retrieve your newly created certificate file, click Download.
segment.target: To retrieve your newly created certificate file, click Download.

segment.source: When you are prompted to download a PEM file, click Save as.
segment.target: When you are prompted to download a PEM file, click Save as.

segment.source: Specify a location for the PEM file and click Save.
segment.target: Specify a location for the PEM file and click Save.

segment.source: Return to the Intune Management Console tab, and click the Upload the APNs Certificate.
segment.target: Return to the Intune Management Console tab, and click the Upload the APNs Certificate.

segment.source: Enter your Apple ID and click Browse.
segment.target: Enter your Apple ID and click Browse.

segment.source: Select the PEM file you just saved, and click Open.
segment.target: Select the PEM file you just saved, and click Open.

segment.source: Click Upload.
segment.target: Click Upload.

segment.source: Your APNs certificate is now configured.
segment.target: Your APNs certificate is now configured.

segment.source: Create a test user group for policy targeting:
segment.target: Create a test user group for policy targeting:

segment.source: In the left pane, click Groups.
segment.target: In the left pane, click Groups.

segment.source: At the far right, click Create Group.
segment.target: At the far right, click Create Group.

segment.source: Provide a group name, select All Users as the parent group, and click Next.
segment.target: Provide a group name, select All Users as the parent group, and click Next.

segment.source: In the Start group membership with field, select All Users in the Parent group, and click Finish.
segment.target: In the Start group membership with field, select All Users in the Parent group, and click Finish.

segment.source: Create an iOS PIN policy and target it to the test user group:
segment.target: Create an iOS PIN policy and target it to the test user group:

segment.source: In the left pane, click Policy.
segment.target: In the left pane, click Policy.

segment.source: At the far right, click Add Policy.
segment.target: At the far right, click Add Policy.

segment.source: Expand the iOS node, select the General Configuration row, and click Create Policy.
segment.target: Expand the iOS node, select the General Configuration row, and click Create Policy.

segment.source: Type a name for the policy, turn on the option Require a password to unlock mobile devices, and set the Minimum password length to 4.
segment.target: Type a name for the policy, turn on the option Require a password to unlock mobile devices, and set the Minimum password length to 4.

segment.source: Click Yes to deploy the policy.
segment.target: Click Yes to deploy the policy.

segment.source: Click the user group previously created, click Add, and click Ok.
segment.target: Click the user group previously created, click Add, and click Ok.

segment.source: You now have an iOS PIN policy that targets your test user group.
segment.target: You now have an iOS PIN policy that targets your test user group.

segment.source: Validate that the policy is enforced on an iOS device
segment.target: Validate that the policy is enforced on an iOS device

segment.source: On an iPad, launch the iOS App Store, install the free Microsoft Intune Company Portal app, and open it.
segment.target: On an iPad, launch the iOS App Store, install the free Microsoft Intune Company Portal app, and open it.

segment.source: Enter your test user account name and password, and tap Sign in.
segment.target: Enter your test user account name and password, and tap Sign in.

segment.source: Tap Enroll to start enrolling the device in Intune.
segment.target: Tap Enroll to start enrolling the device in Intune.

segment.source: On the Install Profile screen, tap Install.
segment.target: On the Install Profile screen, tap Install.

segment.source: On the Install Profile dialog, tap Install.
segment.target: On the Install Profile dialog, tap Install.

segment.source: On the Warning screen, tap Install.
segment.target: On the Warning screen, tap Install.

segment.source: On the Remote Management dialog, tap Trust.
segment.target: On the Remote Management dialog, tap Trust.

segment.source: When the management profile finishes installing, tap Done.
segment.target: When the management profile finishes installing, tap Done.

segment.source: Enrollment is now complete.
segment.target: Enrollment is now complete.

segment.source: When enrollment is complete, tap OK and then close the Company Portal app.
segment.target: When enrollment is complete, tap OK and then close the Company Portal app.

segment.source: When you are prompted to configure a passcode, tap Continue.
segment.target: When you are prompted to configure a passcode, tap Continue.

segment.source: Enter your passcode, tap Continue, enter your passcode again, and tap Save.
segment.target: Enter your passcode, tap Continue, enter your passcode again, and tap Save.

segment.source: Press the power button to lock your iPad, slide to unlock it, and see that you now need to enter your passcode to unlock the device.
segment.target: Press the power button to lock your iPad, slide to unlock it, and see that you now need to enter your passcode to unlock the device.

segment.source: See Also
segment.target: See Also

segment.source: Get started with a paid subscription to Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Get started with a paid subscription to Microsoft Intune

segment.source: Common Microsoft Intune evaluation tasks
segment.target: Common Microsoft Intune evaluation tasks

segment.source: Set up email access for iOS devices using Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Set up email access for iOS devices using Microsoft Intune
